message: There's no one here.
If this temple really does belong to the god Dagon worships, I figured this was the only place any kind of ritual would be held...
Was there anywhere else that seemed likely?

name: Gardner
message: Jonathan......
There's　nowhere　here　you　could　really　hide　a　book.

name: Gardner
message: If you're even a little smart, you wouldn't leave a precious book like that out in the open to get wrecked by the weather, would you？

name: Cordelia
message: Nnh... brr! It's freezing!
A wind carrying tiny grains of ice blows from the sea onto the land.
On the tip of a cape with almost no cover, the cold wind just rips the warmth right out of you, lashing an already exhausted body even more.

name: Thomas
message: What the hell do you think's out here, anyway?
With it this cold, even that monster wouldn't show up.
Honestly, that might just be true.
Out here, it'd be impossible to keep a book in good shape. I don't know who last had the Necronomicon, but no way is this the perfect hiding spot.

name: Cordelia
message: I can't stop shivering...
黒ずんだぬめるような光沢を持った石の柱は、ギリシアの島々に点在する神殿に見られる様式に似ているようだ。
But there's no way these Ruins were brought here from Greece.
Philip was trading with countries in Asia and Africa, so these ruins must've been brought over from there too, no doubt...
I'm an outsider, so I don't have enough knowledge to back up that hypothesis.
Even Gardner, the expert, is baffled, so there's no way I could solve that mystery.
The pillars, made of black stone with a slimy gloss, are surrendering themselves to the slow waves of collapse, without anyone taking notice.
This is the Temple that displays murals, apparently modeled after the bizarre monstrosities I saw firsthand last night.
If we believe the gravekeeper's story that the Dagon Cult worships this Temple, then wouldn't the mural displayed high up there be their god?
But the way the man who was reading the Necronomicon in my dream treated the monster seemed just like he was handling his own servant.
Someone who seems like a god to Dagon is nothing more than a mere servant to the man.
Is it just the difference between someone who has the Necronomicon and someone who doesn't？
It's a building with a solemn, almost unapproachable vibe, that looks like a Temple.
Maybe the consciousness of the people who worshipped this place as the center of their faith is lingering here, because just seeing it makes me feel even afraid.
Marsh said that by bringing these ruins to Arkham, Philip made quite a fortune.
確かに、こんな物を運んでくるのは並大抵の苦労では無かったはずだから、それなりの見返りを期待していたのだろうが‥‥‥
Around the Ruins where the cold wind blows fiercely, you can't find a single person, let alone even a bird flying overhead.
The sound of waves crashing against the sheer cliffs just below is a deafening noise that seems to make the lonely atmosphere of the cape even more intense.
Surrounded by massive Ruins and hearing the terrifying sound of the waves, it really makes you realize just how small you are.
Around the ruins where the cold wind blows fiercely, you can't find a single human, not even a bird flying overhead.

name: Thomas
message: Seriously, can you quit prying into what I'm up to already?

name: Jonathan
message: If that's what you want, then you'd better spill everything you've got hidden in your gut.

name: Thomas
message: I'm not hiding anything.

name: Jonathan
message: That's why I can't trust you.

name: Thomas
message: Then why are you taking me along？
Even though I don't know when you might betray me.

name: Jonathan
message: Even if I say no, you're gonna follow me anyway, right?
Then don't you think it'd be safer if you stayed somewhere I can keep an eye on you？

name: Thomas
message: Well now.........

name: Thomas
message: I don't wanna be stuck in a village like this either.
Let's hurry up and find that Whatever book or something.

name: Gardner
message: 君は真面目に探す気があるのかね？
Where the hell would there even be a place to hide books in a spot like this, with all this wind and rain blowing around?

name: Jonathan
message: So, where do you think we should look for the professor？

name: Gardner
message: 『木の葉を隠すには森の中』という言葉がある。
たくさんの本の中にまぎれてしまえば、それを見つけ　　　　　　　　だすのは非常に困難だと言えよう。

name: Jonathan
message: それでは‥‥‥‥

name: Gardner
message: If it's hard to find, that just means it's the perfect place to hide something.

name: Gardner
message: Anyway, let's just get out of here.
Time is limited.

name: Cordelia
message: I'm already tired......
無理もない、昨晩からほとんど眠っていない上に満足な食事さえとっていないのだから。

name: Jonathan
message: Shall we take a little break somewhere？

name: Cordelia
message: No, that's not it.
But, I've just been running the pub alone for years, without anyone to talk to, and I haven't even met a guy I like.

name: Cordelia
message: When I started thinking, like, what was the point of everything I’ve been doing, all of a sudden I just lost all my strength.

name: Jonathan
message: それももうすぐ終わりじゃないか。
もうすぐこの村から出ていく事ができるんだから。

name: Cordelia
message: Do you really think that will happen？

name: Jonathan
message: Of course I would.
Otherwise, there's no way I'd be going through all this trouble.

name: Cordelia
message: わたし、思うんだけど‥‥‥‥

name: Cordelia
message: I bet someone will get in the way again and try to stop me from being happy.

name: Jonathan
message: Don't say stuff like that.

name: Cordelia
message: I just kinda felt that way......

name: Cordelia
message: Hurry up and find the 'Necronomicon'.
I wanna get out of this village as soon as I can.
Map
